meanings.definition: To invest with legal right or possession.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer infefted the client with ownership of the property.
meanings.sent2: The judge infefted the rightful owner with the deed to the land.
meanings.sent3: The magical wand infefted the young wizard with extraordinary powers.
meanings.sent4: Her words infefted him with a sense of purpose and determination.
meanings.sent5: The golden key infefted the adventurer with the ability to unlock any door.

meanings.definition: To grant a legal right or possession to someone.
meanings.sent1: The king infefted the loyal knight with a title and lands.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor infefted the museum with a valuable art collection.
meanings.sent3: The fairy godmother infefted Cinderella with a beautiful gown and glass slippers.
meanings.sent4: His mentor infefted him with the knowledge and skills needed to succeed.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder infefted the young apprentice with ancient wisdom and guidance.

meanings.definition: To be legally granted a right or possession.
meanings.sent1: After the legal proceedings, she was infefted with full ownership of the company.
meanings.sent2: The heir was infefted with the family estate upon reaching adulthood.
meanings.sent3: The lucky winner of the contest was infefted with a luxurious vacation package.
meanings.sent4: The chosen candidate was infefted with the leadership role in the organization.
meanings.sent5: The artist was infefted with a studio space to create and showcase their work.
